Package com.axelor.utils.helpers.date

Class LocalDateTimeInterval

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.axelor.utils.helpers.date.LocalDateTimeInterval
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<LocalDateTimeInterval>
    public class LocalDateTimeInterval
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<LocalDateTimeInterval>
    LocalDateTimeInterval is a class used to define intervals of time with variable precision.

    For precision of a day better LocalDateInterval

    LocalDateTimeInterval are closed intervals when bounded -> startDateT & endDateT are included in the interval

    startDateT = null means minus-infinite endDateT = null means plus-infinite

    -> new LocalDateTimeInterval(null, null) represent all the past & future

    Comparable on startDateT

      • overlapsOrIsContinuousWith

        public boolean overlapsOrIsContinuousWith​(LocalDateTimeInterval comparedInterval)
        Parameters:
        comparedInterval - the interval to compare with
        Returns:
        true if and only if - the two interval overlaps, - or if comparedInterval.startDateT is before, or at the same moment as the this.endDateT + tolerance from this interval

      • isContinuousAtEndWith

        public boolean isContinuousAtEndWith​(LocalDateTimeInterval comparedInterval)
        Parameters:
        comparedInterval - the interval to compare with
        Returns:
        true if and only if the comparedInterval.startDateT is before, or at the same moment as the this.endDateT + tolerance from this interval

        - Warning, this method will return true if this ends before comparedInterval starts, so even if the 2 intervals does not overlap

      • isContinuousAtStartWith

        public boolean isContinuousAtStartWith​(LocalDateTimeInterval comparedInterval)
        Parameters:
        comparedInterval - the interval to compare with
        Returns:
        true if and only if the comparedInterval.startDateT is before, or at the same moment as the this.endDateT + tolerance from the compared interval

        - Warning, this method will return true if comparedInterval ends before this starts, so even if the 2 intervals does not overlap
